alert.note: Alert for Coastal Collier County; Coastal Miami Dade County; Inland Broward County; Inland Collier County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe; Metro Broward County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Collier, northern Mainland Monroe, northern Miami-Dade and southern Broward Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1129 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a funnel cloud along a line extending from near East Toll Gate On Alligator Alley to 7 miles southwest of Intersection Alligator Alley And Miami Canal to near Dade-Collier Training Airport. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Miami, Hialeah, Pembroke Pines, Miramar, Davie, Miami Gardens, Weston, North Miami, Doral, Miami Lakes, Hialeah Gardens, Opa-Locka, Miami Springs, Miami Shores, North Bay Village, El Portal, Medley, Loop Road Ee Center, Gladeview and Westview. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
